The J reserves the right to cancel a class if there is insufficient registration. If a class or activity is cancelled, you are notified and a full refund is processed automatically. Please allow three to four weeks to receive your refund.

If you cancel your enrollment in a class or activity before the first session, a $10 administrative fee is deducted from your refund. Once a class or activity has begun, or the deadline to cancel enrollment has passed, there are no refunds.

JOB TITLE: Marketing Summer Camp Intern

REPORTS TO: Director of Marketing and Communications/Director of Camping Services

OVERVIEW: The Marketing intern’s primary responsibility will be social media for our J Dallas Summer camps. We are looking for someone who can new ideas and creative energy to our team. The ideal candidate is pursuing a degree in a Marketing related field, passionate about social media and enjoys thinking out of the box!

This position will work closely with Marketing Department and Camp Directors to capture the essence of our summer camp programs, create online engagement, and communicate effectively with camp staff and parents.

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Taking photos and videos throughout camp

• Creating content and brainstorming ideas for social media, reels, and stories

• Monitoring social media accounts, trends, and news

• Scheduling content for JCC Summer Camp Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok account

• Creating and brainstorming ideas for camp newsletters, blogs, and email campaigns

• Some administrative tasks

EDUCATION / REQUIREMENTS:

• Must be actively involved with social media channels including Facebook, Instagram, TikTok either personally or for business / non-profits

• Have a passion for the world of social media marketing and digital marketing

• Strong writing skills

• Currently in school or a recent graduate

• Strong Internet researching and writing skills

• Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and/or Canva

• Photography and Video editing experience is a plus

• Detail-oriented and organized

• Positive attitude and a team player

It is expected that the Marketing Intern will be a team player as part of the JCC professional staff. He/she is expected to be aware of the JCC’s mission statement and work within the frameworks of that mission. Responsibilities of the job may be changed as the needs of the JCC and/or community change.

Send resumes to marketing@jccdallas.org

Pay is commensurate with experience.

JOB TITLE: Performing Arts Camp Sr. Counselors- StarQuest & StarPower

REPORTS TO: Director of J Performing Arts Space

This position as Sr. Camp Counselor at Performing Arts Camp is classified as a Part-Time, Seasonal, Non-Exempt and is not benefits eligible. The Jewish Community Center is an EOE (equal opportunity employer).

Camp StarQuest General Sr. Counselor Job Description:

Join us and be a part of a very magical 4 week theater intensive camp that fuses a top-notch performing arts camp with a traditional camp philosophy. Camp Culminates with a fully produced main-stage musical production. Get ready to have the time of your life!

Camp StarQuest General Counselor is responsible for implementing and assisting with core and non-core program experiences for campers in various group settings. This includes leading a variety of large and small group recreational activities when necessary, in addition to assisting Specialty Counselors with a hands-on, role up your sleeves attitude.

General Counselors will also be responsible for the overall safety, well-being and happiness of campers assigned to his or her group, and must identity and respond to camper behavior issues immediately. Each General Counselor at Camp StarQuest must have experience or a passion for the performing arts – theater, dance, voice, etc.. along with previous experience or a strong desire of working with children. Additionally, the General Counselor will provide a high-quality experience for each camper focusing on being a positive role model that is enthusiastic, team orientated, caring, dependable, fair and fun!

Camp StarPower General Sr. Counselor Job Description:

Join us and be a part of a very magical 2 week camp where children get to create, write and perform in their own original production. Get ready to have the best summer ever!

Camp StarPower General Counselor is responsible for implementing and assisting with core and non-core program experiences for campers in various group settings. This includes leading a variety of large and small group recreational activities when necessary, in addition to assisting Specialty Counselors with a hands-on, role up your sleeves attitude.

General Counselors will also be responsible for the overall safety, well-being and happiness of campers assigned to his or her group, and must identity and respond to camper behavior issues immediately. Each General Counselor at Camp StarPowert must have experience or a passion for the performing arts – theater, dance, voice, etc.. along with previous experience or a strong desire of working with children. Additionally, the General Counselor will provide a high-quality experience for each camper focusing on being a positive role model that is enthusiastic, team orientated, caring, dependable, fair and fun!

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/REQUIREMENTS:

Completion of one year of college

Minimum of three years’ experience in Performance Arts.

Ability to cooperate with others

Ability to supervise campers

Strong interpersonal skills

Ability to carry-out daily and special programs

Experience working with children

Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude

Be dependable and have excellent communication skills

Professional in appearance, manner, and tone

Possess an attitude that makes for harmonious cooperation with campers, parents, and other staff

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $337.50 – $437.50 per week

Benefits:

Employee assistance program

Employee discount

Referral program

Ability to commute/relocate:

Dallas, TX 75230: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Application Question(s):

Are you fully vaccinated against or willing to get vaccinated for COVID-19?

Education:

Associate (Required)

Experience:

Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

Supervising: 1 year (Preferred)

Performing Arts: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

Pay is commensurate with experience.

REPORTS TO: Tennis Director

OVERVIEW: The Tennis Pro-Shop Assistant, under the supervision of the Tennis Director, will be responsible for administrative duties in Tennis department. This position is a part-time, non-exempt position with a maximum of 29 hours per week. The Jewish Community Center is an EOE (equal opportunity employer).

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

ADMINISTRATIVE

Answer telephone, take and distribute messages.

Help maintain departmental records.

Prepare department correspondence including letters and memos.

Catalog copy for Tennis department.

Maintain accident reports.

Prepare room reservation forms.

Assist with merchandise ordering for the Tennis Pro Shop.

CAMP

Data entry of Tennis camp applications.

Maintain records for Tennis camps including health cards, manuals, and carpool lists.

Consult with Tennis Camp Director daily on attendance.

Contact parents as needed for illness, injury, and discipline.

Treat minor injuries and supervise discipline problems.

Attend morning and afternoon briefings.

DEPARTMENTAL

Create special forms and schedules as needed for programming.

Prepare Tennis schedules, rosters and newsletters.

Update Tennis staff schedules.

Assist with checking the membership renewal status of program participants.

Responsible for payment collections for Tennis program payments.

MISCELLANEOUS

Prepare departmental mailing and assist with Center mailings.

Attend Tennis staff meetings weekly.

Handle emergencies quickly and efficiently.

Prepare e-mail blast and a monthly newsletter about Tennis programming.

Assist Tennis Pro with clinics and junior classes.

Listen to the Tennis Pro’s direction and feed tennis balls.

Regular, predictable attendance is required.

Miscellaneous duties as needed.

ESSENTIAL EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

High school diploma or GED required. College preferred.

Customer service experience and training required.

CPR Certification preferred.

OTHER DUTIES:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice as the needs of the JCC and/or community change.

It is expected that the Tennis Pro-Shop Assistant will be a team player as part of the JCC Professional Staff. He/she is expected to be aware of the JCC Mission Statement and work within the frameworks of that mission.

JOB TITLE: Member Services Associate

REPORTS TO: Membership Director and Sports & Fitness Operations Manager

OVERVIEW: The Member Services Associate will be responsible for bringing in new members to the JCC, meeting sales goals and providing customer service. The position will research opportunities to market JCC Membership, make off campus visits, and work with marketing to build marketing campaigns with the goal of selling JCC memberships. This position will also take responsibility to manage the fitness facilities and provide customer service. The position will help maintain customer service standards, fitness equipment maintenance and amenity operations.

This is a Full-time minimum 40 hours per week non-exempt position with benefits. The position has a standard hourly salary plus commission for each membership sold over the budgeted numbers. 20 weekly hours will be dedicated to the membership department and 20 weekly hours will be dedicated to the sports and fitness department. Standard work hours will be Thursday through Monday 8am-5pm with 1 hour lunch break. However, flexibility is necessary as days and hours may change due to marketing events and needs of the agency. The Jewish Community Center is an EOE (equal opportunity employer).

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Membership Department:

Assist Membership Director in the preparation of a sales plan to achieve the membership sales goals of the agency.

Research alternative avenues to market the JCC in events, fairs, organizations and actively participate in related activities to sell JCC Membership.

Actively reach out to potential members and market the JCC Membership.

Offer tours and maintain the highest level of knowledge pertaining to the facility and programs.

Sign up new members and complete paperwork to complete the application process. File and organize applications, tours, sales attempts, and all communication.

Coordinate all mailings to potential new members and help assemble folders.

Partner with marketing and Membership Director in designing and implementing marketing campaigns, promotional offers, and marketing materials.

Prepare reports and presentation about new member sales, promotions, membership statistics and membership related matters.

Support the membership team in providing customer service to current members.

Sports & Fitness Department:

Greet all individuals coming in through the Fitness Center and provide the information and/or services requested in a positive manner. Request member identification cards and scan cards to ensure member is in good standing. Follow procedures for members who do not have proper identification. Handle all incoming calls with the proper greeting. Balance phone customer service with in-person customer service.

Supervise, train, schedule and evaluate part-time Welcome Desk attendants based on established customer service guidelines, business procedures and protocols.

Make sure the Sports & Fitness Center is maintained, equipped with the necessary supplies for member use with inspections and reporting any malfunction or maintenance needs to Fitness Member Services Manager or Maintenance.

Manage Sports & Fitness inventory by tracking, reporting and purchasing necessary supplies.

Maintain constant communication with desk and floor staff. Must be able to ensure that every person working at the welcome desk understands weekly or daily updates about programs, equipment, or maintenance concerns.

Inspect locker rooms and ensure they are clean and all supplies are stocked.

Supervise the Fitness Reception area for proper decorum and general cleanliness

Handle emergencies within the building quickly and efficiently – have thorough knowledge of the JCC Manual for Emergency Planning and Crisis Management.

Complete training on opening and closing procedures for the fitness facility

General Duties:

Attend staff meetings and participate in agency functions, membership events.

Adhere to all agency policies and procedures.

Be consistent and reliable in arrival and attendance.

Perform duties onsite and offsite of employer as assigned.

Complete training sessions with insurance providers, fitness program providers

Complete required training for the agency

Support the membership, main welcome desk, Sports & Fitness Welcome Desk and accounting departments in fulfilling their duties.

Conduct other duties as assigned by supervisor.

ESSENTIAL EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/REQUIREMENTS:

Associates or bachelor’s degree preferred. High school diploma or GED required.

Minimum 2 years of membership sales, customer service and administrative experience

Proficient in all Microsoft Office Programs; intermediate excel required.

Must be assertive, outgoing, sales focused.

Must take initiative and require little supervision.

Strong writing, communication, and organizational skills

Strong customer service and interpersonal skills

Ability to multi-task and prioritize while also fielding calls from members.

Must be efficient and able to complete time sensitive tasks.

Professional appearance, manner, tone, and attitude.

Mus be able to lift 50lbs

Advance computer knowledge preferred

OTHER DUTIES:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice as the needs of the JCC and/or community change. However, this will not be done without prior consultation with the Membership Director.

It is expected that the Member Services Associate will be a team player as part of the Membership, Sports and Fitness team as well as the JCC Professional Staff team. He/she is expected to be aware of the JCC Mission Statement and to work within the framework of the mission. He/she is expected to be innovative, imaginative and a positive role model. He/she must strive to provide the best program available for our members. His/her customer service skills and interpersonal skills must impact every aspect of the job.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $13.00 – $17.00 per hour

JOB TITLE: Digital Marketing Specialist

REPORTS TO: Marketing and Communications Manager

OVERVIEW: As the Digital Marketing Specialist, you will oversee all aspects of email and social media marketing. Including brand awareness, market research, managing contacts, social media engagement and creating and maintaining content calendars.

This position will work closely with department heads to optimize email and social media content planning and execution. The ideal candidate will be a confident communicator with superb writing skills, excellent at prioritizing their workload, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and have strong attention to detail. This position is classified as Exempt and comes with a benefits package. The Jewish Community Center is an EOE (equal opportunity employer).

Essential Job Functions:

· Produce and execute all email campaigns, including building emails from templates or HTML, copywriting, asset coordination, and scheduling.

· Execute a results-driven social media strategy including engaging content for Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, Twitter and YouTube.

· Support various strategic programs via campaigns across the customer lifecycle including prospecting, nurturing, loyalty, retention, and transactional emails.

· Build effective target audiences and segments for every message to drive engagement and revenue performance.

· Manage and execute email/social media marketing calendar and ensure alignment with business priorities, timeliness of events and programs.

· Attend events and programs to capture and produce live social media content.

· Devise and execute A/B tests, manage testing calendar, record results, and advise on improvements. Testing includes subject lines, message content, CTAs, customer cohorts, and segments, and send time to drive performance.

· Interact with users and respond to social media messages, inquiries, and comments.

· Provide regular performance reports for social media and email campaigns that include clicks, opens, conversions, revenue, unsubscribes, etc.

· Regularly identify trends from other leading global brands to glean insights on best practices and new innovative ideas for social media, email marketing tactics, including audits of how we can acquire, nurture, and retain members.

· Experience with paid advertising using measurement tools, integrating management and measurement across multiple channels and paid strategies.

· Create and manage agency forms to obtain leads and build audience and segmentation.

· Graphic Design and/or video editing experience is a plus

· Perform other related duties as assigned.

EDUCATION / REQUIREMENTS:

· B.A. or B.S. in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, or related field of study.

· Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience working in marketing research, analytics, customer service, email marketing and/or social media

· Proven experience managing an email marketing program and analyzing the performance of a large email marketing database.

· Proven experience managing social media and social media management tools (Hootsuite or Sprout Social)

· Detailed knowledge of email regulations, best practices, and compliance internationally in various regulatory regimes (e.g., GDPR or CASL).

· Knowledgeable in Facebook Business Suite, Google Analytics, HTML/CSS, A/B Testing, and other CMS.

· Proficient in data analytics to determine important data and be able to suggest improvements.

· Excellent written communication skills.

· Strong project management skills and exceptional attention to detail.

It is expected that the Digital Marketing Specialist will be a team player as part of the JCC professional staff. He/she is expected to be aware of the JCC’s mission statement and work within the frameworks of that mission. Responsibilities of the job may be changed as the needs of the JCC and/or community change.

JOB TITLE: Painter and Drywall Tech

REPORTS TO: Director of Building & Grounds

OVERVIEW: The Painter and Drywall Tech job is split approximately 60% paint and drywall repair and similar work, and 30% building maintenance, and 10% administrative/work order related tasks. The ideal candidate will provide overall repairs to company buildings, equipment, and fixtures, perform follow-up, and provide oversight of cleaning tasks and vendors for company, and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform some basic painting, drywall removal and repair, remove and installation of wallpaper and vinyl, float sheetrock, minor HVAC/electrical/plumbing related work. This is a Non-Exempt position. The Jewish Community Center is an EOE (equal opportunity employer).

Job Responsibilities and Duties

Essential Job Functions:

Ensures each employee is given the highest level of customer service and every staff member, vendor and other contacts are treated with the utmost respect

Self-dispatch and/or at request of supervisor(s), to facilities to diagnose/repair/engage vendor to repair various mechanical and system issues, including plumbing, roof, doors, electrical, HVAC and other similar systems

Be available by cell phone (as part of overall on-call process) to respond to emergency facility issues (plumbing leaks, clogged toilet etc.)

Work as part of on-call rotation (typically one week on call and several weeks off) as needed, which will include occasional evenings/weekends when must be available by phone and able to respond to emergencies

Troubleshoot issues to determine if problem can be fixed or requires third-party vendor

Work with existing maintenance, janitorial, event setup coordinator and sports and fitness and other staff

Maintain updated and accurate “to-do” list by facility, including efficient use of time

Participate as directed with preventive maintenance plans.

Participate on weekly one on one’s with supervisor

Performs various tasks such as painting, HVAC, change air filters, electric (ballast, bulb replacement etc.), plumbing, cleaning jobsite and oversee 3rd party service providers.

Ability to review, respond, and update work order tickets via computer

Supervisory Responsibility:

None

Other Duties:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover in detail, or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Competencies

Strong organizational skills, ability to multi-task and set priorities and get desired results

Possess the ability to make independent decisions, work independently without direct supervisor

Demonstrable troubleshooting methodology

Positive attitude towards work and accepting direction from supervisor and co-workers

Maintain a neat clean appearance and possess a pleasant demeanor dealing with others (employees, vendors, etc.)

Effective and efficient use of time

Proactively offers to assist other team-members with projects, events, and tasks

Timely attention and organization of paperwork, forms, and communications (email, VM)

Available off-hours via cell phone and email

Must possess basic computer skills, including use of Microsoft product (word, excel, outlook)

Ability to perform simple and moderate tasks including math

Other tasks as directed by supervisor

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent required.

Must have at least 1 year as a full-time hands-on facility maintenance worker, with “handyman” skills for such things as drywall/paint repair, replacement, and resolution of small plumbing fixture issues (toilet valves, replacement of faucets, replacement of fluorescent ballasts/bulbs etc.

Excellent verbal and written communication, and interpersonal skills

Must be willing and able to learn new skills outside of normal comfort zone

Must be willing and able to learn new skills and accept training

Ability to proactively recognize and resolve issues

Work Environment

While performing the duties of this job, the employee must be able to lift 75lbs and/or move up to 75lbs, work on ladders, crawl in/under counters, and work in hot/cold/dusty environments. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to outdoor weather conditions, construction job site work. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The worker is required to have visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, thoroughness of projects and to make general observations of facilities or structures. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to stand, talk, and hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, climb stairs, and stoop.

It is expected that Painter and Drywall Tech will be a team player as part of the JCC Professional Staff. He/she is expected to be aware of the JCC Mission Statement and work within the frameworks of that mission. Responsibilities of the job may be changed as the needs of the JCC and/or community change.

REPORTS TO: Maintenance Supervisor

OVERVIEW: The Facilities Technician position will effectively and efficiently operate and maintain all building functions, including performing maintenance from tenant requests, and carrying out all JCC responsibilities for site with support from the Maintenance Supervisor. This position is full time, classified as non-exempt and comes with a benefit package. The Jewish Community Center is an equal opportunity employer (EOE).

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Maintains good tenant and member relations through prompt and courteous response to requests or work orders within the guidelines set forth by JCC.

Performs general maintenance and operation of all building equipment, including HVAC systems, plumbing systems, electrical systems, lighting systems, dock equipment, building automation systems, etc.

Monitors systems for potential problems (or existing problems) and formulates solutions to present to the Maintenance Supervisor for appropriate action.

Completes all maintenance in a safe manner. Identifies and reports areas of concern or best practices.

Emergency Response Duties – position is considered “on call” for any site emergencies.

Maintains ethical, professional and courteous relations with contractors.

Acts as a team member with all employees of the management staff.

Purchases parts and supplies according to company policy as directed by the Maintenance Supervisor.

Attends weekly team meetings and complies with all written JCC policies and procedures.

Preserves the integrity of all mechanical spaces.

Executes preventative maintenance responsibilities including record keeping.

Walks up and down stairs or ladders for inspections and emergency procedure practice or implementation.

Capable of climbing ladders to adjust airflow and make inspections above the ceiling.

Detects emergency alarms – auditory and/or visual.

Inspects machinery and building, including rooftops.

Ability to work weekends, some nights and extended hours as needed.

ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL ABILITIES:

The physical demands described here are representative of those needed for the employee to succeed in performing the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to see, read, talk and hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use stairs; climb ladders; get on hands and knees; use hands and fingers, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. On a less frequent basis but still essential must be able to lift up to 50 pounds. Capable of utilizing scissor or boom lifts.

ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Reads and understands equipment instruction manuals.

Uses proper English when interacting with tenants and members.

Communicates essential information needed for decision-making.

Interprets a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral or schedule form.

Understands basic building system design and operation, i.e., fire system, domestic water system, HVAC system, plumbing and electrical distribution system.

Identifies and resolves mechanical problems.

Able to read and interpret blue prints and schematics.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/REQUIREMENTS:

Proficiency in one trade area preferred i.e. HVAC, plumbing, carpentry, electric.

Detail oriented and well organized, with ability to plan projects, activities and schedule several months in advance.

Provide excellent customer service and team support. Dedicated to punctuality, reliability, friendliness and helpfulness.

Must have valid Texas driver’s license and reliable transportation.

Ability to effectively and professionally communicate with client contacts.

High School Diploma or GED required.

OTHER DUTIES:

JOB TITLE: Director of Camping Services

REPORTS TO: Associate Director & CFO

OVERVIEW: The Director of Camping Services oversees the creation, promotion, staffing, curriculum, and administrative function of all summer camp programs. Each year, the Director of Camping Services leads all efforts to develop and deliver an annual array of camp programs and opportunities that are fresh and keep pace with current trends. The Director of Camping Services is a leader expected to grow camp by 20% over 3 years and to meet budgeted expectations while working with stakeholders to develop/deliver a vision for camp that is compelling, creative, and profitable. Compliance with state and national licensing is an integral part of the job. This position is classified as full time, exempt, and offers a benefits package. The Jewish Community Center is an EOE (equal opportunity employer).

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Must be passionate about camp and Jewish mission of the JCC.

Develop an attractive array of camp opportunities based on research of the most successful models for camp programming – and on evaluating all aspects of the previous summer.

Maintain effective communication with parents prior to and during camp season (including work w/committee, e-news/blog, special announcements, daily J Gives).

Ability to form relationships with children & families based on mutual respect and caring.

Monitor enrollment for camp; regularly report key benchmarks/statistics to JCC leadership; keep current with licensing; maintain required standards.

Take charge of marketing efforts throughout the year, including working with the marketing department on materials and sales campaign; promote camp in community forums.

Manage the hiring and training process for all camp employees (including recruitment, interviews, work schedule, maintain employee files, attendance for payroll, hiring).

Develop and monitor camp budget; meet budgeted goals.

Infuse Jewish values and ambiance into the JCC camp programs.

Create strategic programs during the year that connect campers back to their summer experience and help recruit prospective campers.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher in the fields of Education, Recreation, Social Work, or significant experience with a religious school(s) or Jewish summer camp(s).

Certified in First Aid, CPR, & Mandated Reporting (Child Abuse).

3-5 years’ experience in field of school age camping.

Proficient in written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to change work schedules as needed for the program.

Proven Budget, administrative and supervision skills.

Experience utilizing social media; marketing skills.

Ability to work around young children with a variety of health issues.

Experience with team management preferred.

Ability to juggle many tasks and deadlines.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office and general computer skills.

Ability to lift upward to 50lbs.

OTHER ATTRIBUTES/DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Director of Camping Services must have an incredible passion for the joys of camp. Together we will create a camp where children learn the Jewish value of Tikkun Olam – repairing the world. A place where children recognize that joy comes with responsibility for themselves, their group, their fellow campers, the facility, and the campgrounds.

To achieve success, constant positivity, a can-do attitude and an abundance of energy tempered by the goal of creating camps that help children learn, grow, and long for more every year are invaluable. A camp progression is an essential process where children look forward to each new year as they have more and more opportunities at camp.

He/she is expected to be innovative, imaginative and a positive role model as well as to maintain a positive attitude and image toward all activities and initiatives of the JCC. He/she must strive to provide the best program available for our campers and members. His/her customer service skills and interpersonal skills must impact every aspect of the job.
